… before the gym closes - no problem. Tonight though, she for some reason thought it would be a good idea to flood the drains with industrial grade bleach as a few ladies and myself were in the showers. Combine that with the steam, and I was …

… burned out and elastic stretch - horrible.  No amount of informing the manager will change it.  The showers barley work putting out so little water.  In the winter the hot water would not work.  People would go home to shower after swimming …

showerReviews.reviewText: The staff is nice, but very crowded place, so I don't think  I will keep my membership. I just do not enjoy being in a cramped environment that doesnt smell clean in bathroom and locker rooms. There is hair all over the showers.  Also, if …

The YMCA has pros and cons. Pros are that the facility itself is generally clean, good classes, good hours, nice staff, and a great community of women in the aquatic classes (some of the nicest women I have met in ChCh/Bethesda); the cons …

Been a member here going on 2 years. I’m a swimmer, and for the money this is the best deal in the MVA. The  outdoor and indoor B pool are awesome, although quite busy. Locker room is fine and the staff for the most part are very nice. Is it perfect? No. But overall this a great place to swim.

While the facilities are good, nobody responded to my email when I wanted to suspend and I ended up paying for many months without using the facilities - sign up is easy but cancellation requires a long process - it is not the same as …

This is the worst YMCA in all of America. It has poor leadership, horrible facilities conditions, and atrocious rec activities (no pickleball after 5pm because it’s dark outside and they won’t turn on the lights). The Managment team needs …
